channel.title: Girlfriend allergic to birth control
channel.description: My girlfriend is allergic to birth control and it worries me for obvious reasons. She's tried all but the T bar and the shot. Every type makes her sick for as long as shes taking it. Her doctor has warned her that the shot will most likely make her have her period for as long as it is in her system which is like 6 months. What can be done besides use condoms and extreme caution? Any one heard of this before? Her mom is the same and the shot did that to her.

item.title: Girlfriend allergic to birth control
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

xEnt:

i hear theres vaginal condoms, not looked into it though, whats that stuff about?

Femidom - think of getting a supermarket plastic bag and shoving that up the vagina.

Although actually supermarket plastic bags are perforated so yeah don’t try that.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Holic wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Looks like everyone agrees.

Ha. So I guess for me it’s pretty no glove no love?
Also:

Unhandled:

And honestly if your entire relationship is based around sex, you’re probably not going to want to have kids with her anyways. You have nothing to lose here.

It isn’t entirely about sex, it’s just a big part. She was a fuck buddy, but we decided to start dating cause we have so much in common.

item.title: Girlfriend allergic to birth control
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Original Daniel:

Condoms really only break if you’re using them wrong, she isn’t wet enough or if you keep them in your wallet for ages. I’ve never had one break but that’s what they said in sex ed. One slipped off inside an old fb when we were drunk once.

Something about the fire&ice ones made them break. They were shit. Other than that none have really broken or anything, just slipped off and inside once

Read full topic

item.title: Girlfriend allergic to birth control
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Holic:

Also, every year that there was some sort of sex ed they strictly told us never to double wrap because it’s more likely to break from friction.

This. Never double wrap, the friction between them makes them bunch up and eventually rip or wear right through

item.title: Girlfriend allergic to birth control
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

the bank:

Condoms are pretty safe overall…but if you want to be super conscious like you fags are, you’re going have to man up and do thigns no man wants to do. (Ex: Double Wrapping).

We always use a condom, but we’ve had a fair amount break on us (Trojan Magnum Fire&Ice break like motherfuckers, never getting them again) and that’s where my concern is. Also, every year that there was some sort of sex ed they strictly told us never to double wrap because it’s more likely to break from friction.

Read full topic

@topic

Condoms are pretty safe overall…but if you want to be super conscious like you fags are, you’re going have to man up and do thigns no man wants to do. (Ex: Double Wrapping).
